basics.name: Reda Lemeden
basics.label: Independent Software Designer & Developer
basics.summary: I am software developer, designer, and product manager (MIM) based in Stockholm, Sweden. Over the past decade, I worked with various Web and native Apple technologies in different full-time positions around the US and Europe. I am passionate about writing, education, open-source, and community involvement. I lead by example and enjoy going the extra mile to deliver delightful products.

work.summary: Author and publish educational and commercial products as an independent software shop.
Provide product and design team leadership with the goal of planning, building, and launching a new mobile product for the retail industry.
highlights: Oversaw the development of a universal iOS app built entirely in SwiftUI.
Worked with the team on different payment integrations including Swish, Klarna, and card payment processors.
Aligned the product, design, and development efforts around the same strategic goals.
Coached the product manager and the product designer and supported them in their day-to-day operations.
Represented the company at various trade fairs and events in Europe.

work.summary: Lead a team of product designers to build new retail experiences for mobile.
highlights: Oversaw the creation and implementation of an expansive design system for mobile.
Refreshed the visual identity of the company and the product line-up.
Organized dozens of design sprints with internal stakeholders and external participants from leading retail companies such as Apple and Ikea.
Built several UI components for iOS, including an in-app notification framework.

work.summary: Design and develop digital products for clients and in-house projects.
highlights: Led a team to build a video consultation app for iOS and Android.
Gave a talk about design sprints at the STHLM TECH Meetup.
Used different design and prototyping tools to create early concepts of a mobile retail product.
Collaborated with other iOS developers to build a native retail application in Swift.

work.summary: Provide design and development services for enterprise and startup clients.
highlights: Co-hosted "Tentative", a weekly podcast about UI design.
Gave talks at local meetups including CocoaHeads and the Dribbble meetup.
Hosted a one-day workshop about iOS and Auto Layout at Hyped Island.
Co-organized on-site workshops covering various Web and native development technologies.
Led and supported the design teams between the two European branches.

work.summary: Design and implement Web and mobile user interfaces for enterprise and startup clients.
highlights: Built the front-end of a large-scale MOOC platform at MIT (edX).
Co-authored Bourbon Neat, a Sass-powered grid framework.
Designed several product interfaces for Web, desktop, and mobile.

work.summary: Design a Web-based CRM product for a 500 Startups alumni (2012).
highlights: Created the visual identity of the company.
Designed a Web-based dashboard UI.

work.summary: Run a design and development consultancy working with clients in Europe and North Africa.
highlights: Authored an RSS reader for iOS in Objective-C.
Illustrated a children's book for teaching Japanese characters (Kana). Published by Kai Japanese School based in Tokyo.

work.summary: Assisted the product manager with various planning, design, and development tasks.
highlights: Desinged the user interface of a multi-platform social network where users can share short audio clips.

awards.title: First prize at the Kai Speech Contest 2009
awards.summary: Gave a speech about living life without regrets.

references.name: Tony Cappaert, Co-Founder & COO at Contactually, ex-Microsoft PM, MIT alum
references.reference: Reda is a rockstar designer. He designed nearly all of the front-end features on Contactually, as well as the logo and iconography used throughout the site. We constantly get complements from users on everything Reda produced. Beyond his design skill, Reda is a pleasure to manage and a strong advocate for the customer. He constantly kept us grounded in what would be the best UX for our users, and his insight was generally spot on. I'd highly recommend Reda for any project requiring beautiful design and effective UX.
